definition: "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
to seek/to strive for/to obtain/see also 牟取[mou2 qu3]
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
premeditated/to plan sth in advance (esp. a crime)
to agree without prior consultation/to happen to hold the same view
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)

sentences.english: He jobbed his son into the position.
sentences.chinese: 他用舞弊手段为儿子谋得这个职位。

sentences.english: She bluffed her way into the job.
sentences.chinese: 她以欺骗手段谋得工作。

sentences.english: Help us to share, to serve, and to seek the common good of all.
sentences.chinese: 帮助我们去分享，去服务，去为所有人谋幸福。

sentences.english: Jiashen spring plans to seek a harmonious Chinese New Chapter.
sentences.chinese: 甲申春日谋大计，和谐中国谱新篇。

sentences.english: But I didn’t do this to get more donations.
sentences.chinese: 但是我不会为此去谋得更多的捐赠。

sentences.english: Therefore, we must seek the correct way to strive for peace.
sentences.chinese: 要寻求“谋和”的正确道路。

sentences.english: The concept of promoting development and security through cooperation has taken a deeper root in the hearts of all.
sentences.chinese: 以合作促发展，以合作谋安全的理念更加深入人心。

sentences.english: He got a position in the bank.
sentences.chinese: 他在银行谋得一个职位。

sentences.english: And Hushai said unto Absalom, The counsel that Ahithophel hath given is not good at this time.
sentences.chinese: 户筛对押沙龙说，亚希多弗这次所定的谋不善。

definition: to plan matters/to look for a job
to work out a strategy/to come up with a plan for
righteousness/virtuous cause/a woman's marriage/main points of a piece of writing
lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
to consider/to turn over in one's mind
to bring peace and stability to the country
